revised_title: Observations of an Extraordinary Aurora Borealis in London
tldr: Dr. Edmond Halley observes an unusual Aurora Borealis in London on November 10, 1719. He describes the white streaks, the canopy of white striae, and the rapid movement of the lights. Halley also notes the calm and serene sky, which seems to be a common factor in Aurora Borealis phenomena.
